intro.speaker: Subaki
intro.line: All right, we're just a stone's throw from the Deeprealm. You must be looking forward to seeing your son again, Saizo.

intro.speaker: Subaki
intro.line: Hmm. I'd swear you look even surlier than usual, Saizo. What's wrong?

intro.speaker: Saizo
intro.line: Ah, just concerned about whether my son is getting the training he needs. He's sixth in a line of Saizos. The firstborn men in our family always take the name. And with the name Saizo comes great expectations. If his training has failed him, my son will be a subpar Saizo. I can't have that. He's much older since last I saw him. I have a fairly severe test in mind. Hmm? People. Ahead.

intro.speaker: Funke
intro.line: What? You refuse your mission? That reeks of treachery. Reconsider, child.

intro.speaker: Asugi
intro.line: Not happening. You could double my cut, and I'd still refuse. I'm out.

intro.speaker: Saizo
intro.line: What in all the bitter hells are you doing here, Son?!

intro.speaker: Asugi
intro.line: And now you too?! If this ain't the brown sprinkles on my sundae...

intro.speaker: Funke
intro.line: What?! You know this boorish blackguard, Asugi?

intro.speaker: Asugi
intro.line: Yup. Sorta.

intro.speaker: Saizo
intro.line: Did he just call you Asugi? What's the meaning of this, Saizo? You have the proud honor of taking MY name, as I took that of my father! You were born a Saizo. You will die a Saizo. That is our family's custom. Besides, who is this fool?

intro.speaker: Asugi
intro.line: Huh? As always, you don't know your head from a hole in the ground. Get lost.

intro.speaker: Funke
intro.line: No, no, no, Asugi, Don't be so rude. He and his friends are our guests! Uninvited, yes. But they can't leave our little party now. They can, in fact, help you fulfill your obligations at this fine affair!

intro.speaker: Saizo
intro.line: Hmm? Obligations? What does he mean by that, Saizo?

intro.speaker: Funke
intro.line: This spoiled guttersnipe wants to abandon our happy family. And right before we're about to break into a manor that will make us fabulously rich. Tsk! Youth, these days.

intro.speaker: Saizo
intro.line: Break into a manor? Are you a thief now? You work for this powdered cretin?

intro.speaker: Asugi
intro.line: Ha! That's my business.

intro.speaker: Saizo
intro.line: I expect more out of you. You shirk your duties as a firstborn Saizo? Sixth in the line?! And you think I won't make that my business?

intro.speaker: Asugi
intro.line: What a crock. Saizo this?! Sixth that?! You can take your name and- Well, you know.

intro.speaker: Saizo
intro.line: WHAT?!

intro.speaker: Asugi
intro.line: I don't take orders. Not from you. Not from anyone. You care about your dumb name more than you've ever cared about me. It's my life. I'll live as I please. See ya.

intro.speaker: Saizo
intro.line: See ya?! No one gets away from me. Not over my dead-

intro.speaker: Funke
intro.line: No, no, no! Now that my Asugi has fled, let's have no more departing bodies. At least, not until I make you pay for driving off my talented associate.

intro.speaker: Saizo
intro.line: What's my damned son gotten us into?!

intro.speaker: Saizo
intro.line: That's it. Last chance, Son! Get back here.

intro.speaker: Asugi
intro.line: Whoops, sorry! Can't hear you! See ya never, old man!

intro.speaker: Saizo
intro.line: Damn that kid. We have to catch up with him before he gets away!

boss.speaker: Funke
boss.line: Ah, one of our guests! Well then, let me extend my invitation to you... An invitation—to die!

end.speaker: Asugi
end.line: Stop chasing me!

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: Never. Now tell me, why did you take up with such low creatures?

end.speaker: Asugi
end.line: Gotta do something to satisfy my sweet tooth. Besides, you got it all wrong. Or half wrong. Just before you showed up, I told Funke that I didn't want any part of this. When he hired me, he failed to say my job was to sneak in and off the owner. I'll steal anything that's not nailed down. But murder—like that? Nah. Crosses a line. And there's NO price he could pay me to do that. Got my pride, I guess.

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: Do you?

end.speaker: Asugi
end.line: What now, genius? You gonna lock me up in my Deeprealm?

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: ... No. You're free to go.

end.speaker: Asugi
end.line: What's that again?

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: You heard me. You're no longer the sixth in a proud succession of Saizos... You deserve to be Asugi.

end.speaker: Asugi
end.line: Wasn't expecting that... But, wait, is this some sort of trick?

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: No trick. The whole point of being called Saizo is to live up to the honor. You...have a sense of honor. In your own way. So, go.

end.speaker: Asugi
end.line: Dad...

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: Oh, Dad now, is it? Good-bye. Enjoy your life.

end.speaker: Asugi
end.line: ...Whatever. i wasn't asking for permission. But if it IS my life? I'm coming with you.

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: What? Kid, you make my head hurt.

end.speaker: Asugi
end.line: Yeah, I do that. But if I'm off the hook for all this Saizo junk... I think I'd like to tag along with you. Could learn a thing or two. And maybe I can fix that sourpuss face of yours while I'm at it. Ever heard of candy?

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: Candy? Don't tell me that's been a sucker in your mouth this whole time. I thought you were chewing on a blade of grass like some kind of tough guy.

end.speaker: Asugi
end.line: Mmm, candy. Yeah, no—I'm all about the sweet stuff. 'Specially if it's on a stick. Suckers. Peppermint sticks. Candy apples. But only if they're really tiny apples. You could say I'm a connoisseur. That's why I steal. Good stuff's expensive. You're gonna love it.

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: No. I don't eat sweets.

end.speaker: Asugi
end.line: Ha! Yeah, obviously. And that's why your face is stuck that way.

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: But maybe I'll try just one. I mean, since you worked so hard to pay for it all. Hmm. Asugi, if you manage to not wind up a victim of your own foolishness...You might make me half-proud of you.

end.speaker: Asugi
end.line: Huh? Well, if we're getting all touchy-feely here... I'm hoping you're half the Saizo you think you are, Dad. Otherwise I may live to regret this.
